overview: Two women meet at a crossroads... A chance encounter between two women struggling to stay afloat, in an era of the downsizing of dreams. Ross Lipman's one fiction film to date comes from a genre even more rare in the US than experimental work-adult drama. Printed in muted tones that conjure silent film hand-painting, and merging theater-based naturalism with an elliptical psychological encounter, "The Interview" at once utilizes and destroys mainstream narrative expectations.
title: The Interview
